responses.rationale: The segment reports factual information about the virus's spread without any explicit calming cues or reassuring language.
The phrase 'do not present an immediate public health concern' is a bare negation, explicitly excluded from Q5 as a calming cue.
This segment states a factual method for killing bacteria and viruses but does not use explicit calming language like 'safe to eat' or 'no danger'.
This is an editorial note about a correction and contains no explicit calming cues.
This is an editorial note about an update and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports negative facts about virus spread and an undercount, lacking any explicit calming cues.
The segment reports a negative finding (trace amounts of H5N1 in milk) without any explicit calming cues.
The segment reports restrictions and testing, which are actions, but does not contain explicit calming cues.
The segment reports a high fatality rate, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment explains the spread of the disease but does not contain any explicit calming cues.
The segment reports confirmed cases in flocks, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports confirmation of the virus on a farm, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports new cases on farms, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment states a factual production number and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment states factual production data and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports the killing of birds due to outbreaks, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports the killing of birds due to new cases, which is a negative fact, and contains no explicit calming cues.
The segment reports new infections and forced killing of birds, which are negative facts, and contains no explicit calming cues.
